title: NEAIRA
content:
NEAIRA (Neaera) was a Naiad-nymph of Mount Sipylos in Lydia (western Anatolia). She was the mother of Dresaios
        (Dresaeus), a Lydian ally of the Trojans in their war with the Greeks.

Quintus Smyrnaeus, Fall of Troy 1. 290 ff (trans. Way) (Greek epic C4th A.D.)
          :
        "[In the Trojan War the Greek warrior] Polypoites (Polypoetes), dear to Ares, slew Dresaios (Dresaeus),
        whom the Nymphe Neaira (Neaera) bare to passing-wise Theiodamas for these spread was the bed of love beside the
        foot of Sipylos the Mountain."
